channel.title: CyberNetSec - Data Breach
channel.description: Latest data breach threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: Healthcare Breaches Seem to Drop, But Government Shutdown Hides True Numbers
item.description:
Official data for September 2025 shows only 26 major healthcare data breaches, the lowest monthly total since 2018. However, The HIPAA Journal cautions that this apparent decline is misleading. A US government shutdown has largely halted the HHS's Office for Civil Rights (OCR) from processing and up...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Data Breach, Regulatory, Policy and Compliance

Read Full Article →

item.title: Palomar Health Breach Exposes Highly Sensitive Patient Data, Including Biometrics
item.description:
Palomar Health Medical Group (PHMG), a California-based healthcare provider, has announced it was the victim of a cybersecurity incident that exposed sensitive patient data. The compromised information includes not only names and personal identifiers but also highly sensitive data types such as biom...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Regulatory

Read Full Article →

item.title: Patch Now: Critical RCE Flaws in Oracle E-Business Suite Marketing Module
item.description:
Oracle has issued urgent patches for two critical, unauthenticated remote code execution (RCE) vulnerabilities in its E-Business Suite. The flaws, CVE-2025-53072 and CVE-2025-62481, both carry a CVSS score of 9.8 and affect the Oracle Marketing module. An attacker with network access can exploit the...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Data Breach

Read Full Article →

item.title: DHS Breach: 'CitrixBleed 2.0' Zero-Day Exposes FEMA & CBP Employee Data
item.description:
A critical zero-day vulnerability in Citrix NetScaler Gateway, dubbed 'CitrixBleed 2.0' (CVE-2025-5777), was exploited to breach the U.S. Department of Homeland Security. The attack, which began in June 2025, compromised the personal and employment data of staff at the Federal Emergency Management A...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Data Breach, Vulnerability, Cyberattack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Lending Platform Prosper Breached, 17.6 Million Accounts Exposed
item.description:
The peer-to-peer lending platform Prosper has confirmed a massive data breach that exposed the personal and sensitive information of approximately 17.6 million user accounts. The breach notification service 'Have I Been Pwned' has already incorporated the data set, which includes names, email addres...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Phishing, Regulatory

Read Full Article →

item.title: Clop Ransomware Claims Harvard University Breach, Threatens Data Leak
item.description:
The prolific Russian-speaking ransomware group Clop has claimed responsibility for a cyberattack against Harvard University, adding the prestigious institution to its data leak site on October 12, 2025. The group, known for its 'big-game hunting' and exploitation of zero-day vulnerabilities, threate...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Actor, Data Breach

Read Full Article →

item.title: F5 Breached by Nation-State Actor; BIG-IP Source Code Stolen, CISA Issues Emergency Directive
item.description:
Application security vendor F5 has disclosed a major security breach attributed to a 'highly sophisticated nation-state threat actor.' The attackers maintained long-term access to F5's internal development environments, exfiltrating portions of the BIG-IP source code, information on undisclosed vuln...

Severity: Critical

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Data Breach, Threat Actor

Read Full Article →

item.title: Panera Bread Reaches $2.5M Settlement for 2024 Data Breach
item.description:
Panera Bread has agreed to a $2.5 million settlement to resolve a class-action lawsuit related to a data breach that occurred in March 2024. The breach exposed the personal information, including names and Social Security numbers, of approximately 147,321 individuals, primarily current and former em...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Data Breach, Regulatory, Policy and Compliance

Read Full Article →

item.title: Volkswagen Probes 8Base Ransomware Attack Claim
item.description:
The Volkswagen Group is investigating a claim from the 8Base ransomware group that it has breached the automotive giant and stolen sensitive data. 8Base, a data extortion group linked to Phobos ransomware, posted a trove of allegedly stolen files on its dark web site, including accounting documents ...

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Supply Chain Attack

Read Full Article →

item.title: Deloitte to Pay $6.3M in Settlement for Rhode Island Data Breach Affecting 640,000
item.description:
Deloitte has agreed to a proposed $6.3 million class-action settlement related to a 2024 cyberattack that compromised the personal data of 640,000 Rhode Island residents—nearly half the state's population. The breach affected the state's 'RIBridges' social services system, which was managed by Deloi...

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Regulatory, Policy and Compliance

Read Full Article →
